intro: Dianthus gracilis subsp. gracilis, commonly known as the slender pink, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It features upright stems with narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of delicate, pink or white flowers with five petals. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and blooms from late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its botanical characteristics make it well-suited for cultivation in Mediterranean climates.
